column4: hey there, im having trouble with getting my wifi to work since an update
try lsusb or lshw  what device is it?

well using iwconfig tells me its a RaLink STA, lshw tells me theres an Atheros AR8132, if i try and plug my ubuntu machine into another ubuntu computer that's working, eth0 fails to connect to the net
seems that device has a history.  I think you need to find a driver to compile or find another kernel 2.6.27 that suposed to have it already
cheers :D is there any hassle free way of doing it? via .deb or apt-get?
you might try jockey-gtk
but I think the working one is an open source solution
so where would i go to get it?
jokey-gtk  System>administration>Hardware driver
and the kernel there must be a deb file for
yeah i tryed that and simply got "no propriartary drivers are in use on this system"
I'm still looking for the kernel deb file
cheers :D apparently the driver required is for the Ralink3090 PCIe card
so we looking for the wrong ones?
heres what ive seen http://www.linlap.com/wiki/asus+eee+pc+1001ha
but ive tryed installing those drivers with no success
I found this one http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1219931
looks good :D is there a command to display my kernal version?
uname -a
cheers :D
well I hope that gets you there I got to go but we have a whole team here that can continue to help you if needed.
thanks :D ill see how i get on
